 Load: lg_fem lg_mesh lg_mesh3 eigenvalue 
    1 : real a0;
    2 : ifstream entrada("input_a0.txt");
    3 : entrada >> a0;
    4 : 
    5 : real phi = pi/2.0 - a0; // mant√©n esto si phi depende de a0
    6 : 
    7 : verbosity = 1;
    8 : real cpu = clock();
    9 : int seed = 123456789;
   10 : //randinit(100*clock());
   11 : 
   12 : /**
   13 : Variable Definitions
   14 : */
   15 : 
   16 : int npart = 1; //Number of particles
   17 : real boxwd = 20.0; // width of the cell containing the system
   18 : real boxht = 20.0; // height of the cell containing the system
   19 : real xradius = 1.0; // horizontal axis of the particles
   20 : real yradius = 2.0; // vertical axis of the particles
   21 : real xshift = 0.0; // horizontal shift from the center of the cell
   22 : real yshift = 0.0; // vertical shift form the center of the cell
   23 : //real a0 = 89.9*pi/180.0; // Tilt angle measured from +x axis. 
   24 : //real phi = pi/2.0 -a0; // angle between easy axis and external app field
   25 : real npoints = 57.0; //points in half the hysteresis curve
   26 : int mp = 50; // number of points in the mesh "meshpoints"
   27 : real beta = 3e-6; // constant to enter random variations
   28 : real t=1e-3; // tolerance for the code 
   29 : real initialfield = -5.0; // initial field
   30 : real finalfield = 5.0; // final (end) field
   31 : 
   32 : 
   33 : // real[int] is a vector of "int" elements. Each element is a real
   34 : real[int] mx(npart); //mx is vector storing horizontal magnetization
   35 : real[int] mxpast(npart); // mx in a past state for comparison
   36 : real[int] my(npart); //my is a vector storing vertical magnetization
   37 : real[int] mypast(npart); // my in a past state for comparison
   38 : real[int] V(npart); //V is a vector storing the volume of each particle
   39 : real[int] h(2); // vector storing the external magnetic field
   40 : real[int] Gradmx(2); // horizontal component of the Grad
   41 : real[int] Gradmy(2); // vertical component of the Grad 
   42 : real Tvolume; // Total volume 
   43 : real theta;
   44 : real hi; // auxiliar variable for external field
   45 : real hf; // auxiliar variable for external field
   46 : real dh; // Step to change the external field
   47 : real E0; // Energy in the actual system
   48 : real E1; // Energy in the state with proposed magnetization
   49 : real Ea; // Energy in the state with optimal magnetization for monitoring the energy
   50 : real gnorm; // Norm of the gradient
   51 : real mnorm; // Norm of the magnetization
   52 : real dirx; // Horizontal component of the normalized gradient
   53 : real diry; // Vertical component of the normalized gradient
   54 : real st; // step
   55 : real dE; // Energy difference
   56 : real mtotx; // total horizontal magnetization 
   57 : real mtoty; // total vertical magnetization
   58 : real it; // iteration counter
   59 : real flag; // Auxiliar variable that acts as a flag 
   60 : matrix A; // Matrix for the variational formulation
   61 : real s1; // Switch for conditionals
   62 : real s2; // Switch for conditionals
   63 : 
   64 : 
   65 : /**
   66 : Variables computed on the above
   67 : */
   68 : real xcenter= boxwd/2.0;
   69 : real ycenter= boxht/2.0;
   70 : 
   71 : /**
   72 : Filename generator
   73 : */
   74 : 
   75 : string name = "SW"+"X"+string(xradius)+"Y"+string(yradius)+"A"+string(phi*180.0/pi);
   76 : ofstream outfile(name+".txt");
   77 : //ofstream outfile("tester"+string(phi*180.0/pi)+".txt");
   78 : //ofstream outfile("tester.txt");
   79 : ofstream efile("Efile.txt");
   80 : 
   81 : /**
   82 : Space under construction
   83 : */
   84 : border b1(t=0.0,boxwd){x=t; y=0.0; label=901;};
   85 : border b2(t=0.0,boxht){x=boxwd; y=t; label=902;};
   86 : border b3(t=0.0,boxwd){x=boxwd-t; y=boxht; label=903;};
   87 : border b4(t=0.0,boxht){x=0.0; y=boxht-t; label=904;};
   88 : 
   89 : border B0(t=0, 2.0*pi){
   90 :   x= xcenter +xradius*cos(t)*cos(a0) -yradius*sin(t)*sin(a0) +xshift;
   91 :   y= ycenter +xradius*cos(t)*sin(a0) +yradius*sin(t)*cos(a0) +yshift;
   92 :   label=0;
   93 : };
   94 : 
   95 : mesh Th = buildmesh(b1(mp)+ b2(mp)+ b3(mp)+ b4(mp)+ B0(-mp) );
   96 : //plot(Th, wait=1);
   97 : 
   98 : // Auxiliar mesh to calculate the volume of each partile
   99 : // Make one for every particle in the volume count
  100 : mesh Thaux0 = buildmesh(B0(mp));
  101 : 
  102 : /**
  103 : Constructing the variational formulation and space functions
  104 : */
  105 : 
  106 : // Uncomment this section for periodic boundary conditions
  107 : /**
  108 : fespace Vh(Th, P1, periodic=[[901,x],[903,x],[902,y],[904,y]]);
  109 : Vh uh, vh, hx, hy, F;
  110 : varf aa(uh,vh)= int2d(Th)( dx(uh)*dx(vh) +dy(uh)*dy(vh) );
  111 : */
  112 : 
  113 : // Uncomment this section for Zero Boundary Conditions
  114 : fespace Vh(Th, P1);
  115 : Vh uh, vh, hx, hy, F; // Functions living in Vh
  116 : varf aa(uh,vh)= int2d(Th)( dx(uh)*dx(vh) +dy(uh)*dy(vh) ) 
  117 :                 +on(901,902,903,904, uh=0);
  118 : 
  119 : // add one int1d for each particle in the array
  120 : varf ff(unused, vh)= -int1d(Th,0)( (mx(0)*N.x +my(0)*N.y)*vh )
  121 :                      //-int1d(Th,1)( (mx(1)*N.x +my(1)*N.y)*vh )
  122 :                       ;
  123 : 
  124 : // Initiating magnetization. We also use this cicle to 
  125 : // compute the volume of the particles and the total volume
  126 : V(0)= int2d(Thaux0)(1.0);
  127 : Tvolume = 0.0;
  128 : 
  129 : for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  130 :     randinit( seed*clock() );
  131 :     theta= randreal2()*45.0*pi/180.0;
  132 :     mx(i)= cos(theta);
  133 :     my(i)= sin(theta);
  134 :     Tvolume= Tvolume +V(i);
  135 : }
  136 : cout << "M_initial=" << "	 mx=" << mx(0) << "	 my=" << my(0) << "	 m^2=" <<mx(0)^2 + my(0)^2 << endl;
  137 : 
  138 : hi= initialfield;
  139 : hf= finalfield;
  140 : dh = (hf-hi)/npoints;
  141 : while (hi<hf){
  142 :     h= [0.0,hi];
  143 :     flag=0;
  144 :     st=0.5;
  145 :     it=0;
  146 :     cout << "Getting the magnetization for h=" << hi << endl;
  147 :     while (flag==0){
  148 :         s1=0;
  149 :         s2=0;
  150 :         mxpast = mx;
  151 :         mypast = my;
  152 :         // Solving the weak form
  153 :         A = aa(Vh,Vh);
  154 :         F[] = ff(0,Vh);
  155 :         uh[] = A^-1*F[];
  156 :         hx = dx(uh);
  157 :         hy = dy(uh);
  158 :         // Computing energy for actual state
  159 :         E0= 0.5*int2d(Th)( hx*hx +hy*hy ); // Magnetostatic energy term
  160 :         for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  161 :         E0= E0 -V(i)*( mx(i)*h[0] +my(i)*h[1] ); // Zeeman energy term
  162 :         }
  163 :         // Computing the Gradient with respect m of each particle
  164 :         for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  165 :             Gradmx(i)= -int1d(Th,i)( uh*N.x ) -V(i)*h[0];
  166 :             Gradmy(i)= -int1d(Th,i)( uh*N.y ) -V(i)*h[1];
  167 :             gnorm= sqrt(Gradmx(i)^2.0 +Gradmy(i)^2.0);
  168 :             dirx= Gradmx(i)/gnorm;
  169 :             diry= Gradmy(i)/gnorm;
  170 :             // Moving the magnetization to the posterior state
  171 :             mx(i)= mx(i) -st*dirx +beta*randreal1();
  172 :             my(i)= my(i) -st*diry +beta*randreal1();
  173 :             mnorm= sqrt( mx(i)^2.0 +my(i)^2.0 );
  174 :             mx(i)= mx(i)/mnorm;
  175 :             my(i)= my(i)/mnorm;
  176 :         }
  177 :         //cout << "M_h"<< hi << "=" << mx(0) << "__" << my(0) <<"__" <<mx(0)^2 + my(0)^2 << endl;
  178 :         // Solving the weak form for the posterior state
  179 :         A= aa(Vh,Vh);
  180 :         F[]= ff(0,Vh);
  181 :         uh[]= A^-1*F[];
  182 :         hx= dx(uh); hy= dy(uh);
  183 :         // Computing energy for the posterior state
  184 :         E1= 0.5*int2d(Th)( hx*hx +hy*hy );
  185 :         for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  186 :         E1= E1 -V(i)*( mx(i)*h[0] +my(i)*h[1] );
  187 :         }
  188 :         dE= E0 -E1;
  189 :         if (E0 -E1 > 0){
  190 :             //cout << hi << "  OK  " << E0 << "\t" << E1 << "\t" <<
  191 :             //    mx(0) << "\t" << my(0) <<  endl;
  192 :             s1=1.0;
  193 :         }
  194 :         else{
  195 :             //cout << hi << "  Error  " << E0 << "\t" << E1 << "\t" <<
  196 :             //    mx(0) << "\t" << my(0) <<  endl;
  197 :             st= 0.5*st;
  198 :             mx= mxpast;
  199 :             my= mypast;
  200 :         }
  201 :         if (abs(dE) < 1e-8){
  202 :             s1=1.0;
  203 :         }
  204 :         if (abs(dE) < t){
  205 :             s2= 1.0;   
  206 :         }
  207 :         //cout << hi << "\t" << s1 << "\t" << dE << "\t" << s2 << endl;
  208 :         cout << "h=" <<hi << "	 E0=" << E0 << endl;
  209 :         if (s1*s2 >= 1){
  210 :             flag=1;
  211 :         }  
  212 :     }
  213 :     plot(uh ,value=1, wait=0, fill=1);
  214 :     mtotx=0.0;
  215 :     mtoty=0.0;
  216 :     for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  217 :         mtotx= mtotx +mx(i)*V(i)/Tvolume;
  218 :         mtoty= mtoty +my(i)*V(i)/Tvolume;
  219 :     }
  220 :     Ea= 0.5*int2d(Th)( hx*hx +hy*hy );
  221 :     for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  222 :     Ea= Ea -V(i)*( mx(i)*h[0] +my(i)*h[1] );
  223 :     }
  224 :     cout << "Energy minimum found for h=" << hi << endl;
  225 :     cout << "M=(" << mtotx << "," << mtoty << ")" << endl;
  226 :     cout << "E=" << Ea << endl;
  227 :     outfile << (h(0)) +"	"+ (h(1)) +"	"+ mtotx +"	"+ mtoty << endl;
  228 :     efile << Ea +"	" +mx(0) +"	" +my(0) << endl;
  229 :     it= it+1;
  230 :     hi = hi +dh;
  231 : }
  232 : 
  233 : //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  234 : // DOWNWARD CYCLE
  235 : //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  236 : 
  237 : hi= finalfield;
  238 : hf= initialfield;
  239 : dh= (hf-hi)/npoints;
  240 : //while (hi>hf){

-- FreeFem++ v4.15 (Wed Dec 11 16:48:56 CET 2024 - git v4.15-7-gb1e524c8c)

 Load: lg_fem lg_mesh lg_mesh3 eigenvalue 
    1 : real a0;
    2 : ifstream entrada("input_a0.txt");
    3 : entrada >> a0;
    4 : 
    5 : real phi = pi/2.0 - a0; // mant√©n esto si phi depende de a0
    6 : 
    7 : verbosity = 1;
    8 : real cpu = clock();
    9 : int seed = 123456789;
   10 : //randinit(100*clock());
   11 : 
   12 : /**
   13 : Variable Definitions
   14 : */
   15 : 
   16 : int npart = 1; //Number of particles
   17 : real boxwd = 20.0; // width of the cell containing the system
   18 : real boxht = 20.0; // height of the cell containing the system
   19 : real xradius = 1.0; // horizontal axis of the particles
   20 : real yradius = 2.0; // vertical axis of the particles
   21 : real xshift = 0.0; // horizontal shift from the center of the cell
   22 : real yshift = 0.0; // vertical shift form the center of the cell
   23 : //real a0 = 89.9*pi/180.0; // Tilt angle measured from +x axis. 
   24 : //real phi = pi/2.0 -a0; // angle between easy axis and external app field
   25 : real npoints = 57.0; //points in half the hysteresis curve
   26 : int mp = 50; // number of points in the mesh "meshpoints"
   27 : real beta = 3e-6; // constant to enter random variations
   28 : real t=1e-3; // tolerance for the code 
   29 : real initialfield = -5.0; // initial field
   30 : real finalfield = 5.0; // final (end) field
   31 : 
   32 : 
   33 : // real[int] is a vector of "int" elements. Each element is a real
   34 : real[int] mx(npart); //mx is vector storing horizontal magnetization
   35 : real[int] mxpast(npart); // mx in a past state for comparison
   36 : real[int] my(npart); //my is a vector storing vertical magnetization
   37 : real[int] mypast(npart); // my in a past state for comparison
   38 : real[int] V(npart); //V is a vector storing the volume of each particle
   39 : real[int] h(2); // vector storing the external magnetic field
   40 : real[int] Gradmx(2); // horizontal component of the Grad
   41 : real[int] Gradmy(2); // vertical component of the Grad 
   42 : real Tvolume; // Total volume 
   43 : real theta;
   44 : real hi; // auxiliar variable for external field
   45 : real hf; // auxiliar variable for external field
   46 : real dh; // Step to change the external field
   47 : real E0; // Energy in the actual system
   48 : real E1; // Energy in the state with proposed magnetization
   49 : real Ea; // Energy in the state with optimal magnetization for monitoring the energy
   50 : real gnorm; // Norm of the gradient
   51 : real mnorm; // Norm of the magnetization
   52 : real dirx; // Horizontal component of the normalized gradient
   53 : real diry; // Vertical component of the normalized gradient
   54 : real st; // step
   55 : real dE; // Energy difference
   56 : real mtotx; // total horizontal magnetization 
   57 : real mtoty; // total vertical magnetization
   58 : real it; // iteration counter
   59 : real flag; // Auxiliar variable that acts as a flag 
   60 : matrix A; // Matrix for the variational formulation
   61 : real s1; // Switch for conditionals
   62 : real s2; // Switch for conditionals
   63 : 
   64 : 
   65 : /**
   66 : Variables computed on the above
   67 : */
   68 : real xcenter= boxwd/2.0;
   69 : real ycenter= boxht/2.0;
   70 : 
   71 : /**
   72 : Filename generator
   73 : */
   74 : 
   75 : string name = "SW"+"X"+string(xradius)+"Y"+string(yradius)+"A"+string(phi*180.0/pi);
   76 : ofstream outfile(name+".txt");
   77 : //ofstream outfile("tester"+string(phi*180.0/pi)+".txt");
   78 : //ofstream outfile("tester.txt");
   79 : ofstream efile("Efile.txt");
   80 : 
   81 : /**
   82 : Space under construction
   83 : */
   84 : border b1(t=0.0,boxwd){x=t; y=0.0; label=901;};
   85 : border b2(t=0.0,boxht){x=boxwd; y=t; label=902;};
   86 : border b3(t=0.0,boxwd){x=boxwd-t; y=boxht; label=903;};
   87 : border b4(t=0.0,boxht){x=0.0; y=boxht-t; label=904;};
   88 : 
   89 : border B0(t=0, 2.0*pi){
   90 :   x= xcenter +xradius*cos(t)*cos(a0) -yradius*sin(t)*sin(a0) +xshift;
   91 :   y= ycenter +xradius*cos(t)*sin(a0) +yradius*sin(t)*cos(a0) +yshift;
   92 :   label=0;
   93 : };
   94 : 
   95 : mesh Th = buildmesh(b1(mp)+ b2(mp)+ b3(mp)+ b4(mp)+ B0(-mp) );
   96 : //plot(Th, wait=1);
   97 : 
   98 : // Auxiliar mesh to calculate the volume of each partile
   99 : // Make one for every particle in the volume count
  100 : mesh Thaux0 = buildmesh(B0(mp));
  101 : 
  102 : /**
  103 : Constructing the variational formulation and space functions
  104 : */
  105 : 
  106 : // Uncomment this section for periodic boundary conditions
  107 : /**
  108 : fespace Vh(Th, P1, periodic=[[901,x],[903,x],[902,y],[904,y]]);
  109 : Vh uh, vh, hx, hy, F;
  110 : varf aa(uh,vh)= int2d(Th)( dx(uh)*dx(vh) +dy(uh)*dy(vh) );
  111 : */
  112 : 
  113 : // Uncomment this section for Zero Boundary Conditions
  114 : fespace Vh(Th, P1);
  115 : Vh uh, vh, hx, hy, F; // Functions living in Vh
  116 : varf aa(uh,vh)= int2d(Th)( dx(uh)*dx(vh) +dy(uh)*dy(vh) ) 
  117 :                 +on(901,902,903,904, uh=0);
  118 : 
  119 : // add one int1d for each particle in the array
  120 : varf ff(unused, vh)= -int1d(Th,0)( (mx(0)*N.x +my(0)*N.y)*vh )
  121 :                      //-int1d(Th,1)( (mx(1)*N.x +my(1)*N.y)*vh )
  122 :                       ;
  123 : 
  124 : // Initiating magnetization. We also use this cicle to 
  125 : // compute the volume of the particles and the total volume
  126 : V(0)= int2d(Thaux0)(1.0);
  127 : Tvolume = 0.0;
  128 : 
  129 : for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  130 :     randinit( seed*clock() );
  131 :     theta= randreal2()*45.0*pi/180.0;
  132 :     mx(i)= cos(theta);
  133 :     my(i)= sin(theta);
  134 :     Tvolume= Tvolume +V(i);
  135 : }
  136 : cout << "M_initial=" << "	 mx=" << mx(0) << "	 my=" << my(0) << "	 m^2=" <<mx(0)^2 + my(0)^2 << endl;
  137 : 
  138 : hi= initialfield;
  139 : hf= finalfield;
  140 : dh = (hf-hi)/npoints;
  141 : while (hi<hf){
  142 :     h= [0.0,hi];
  143 :     flag=0;
  144 :     st=0.5;
  145 :     it=0;
  146 :     cout << "Getting the magnetization for h=" << hi << endl;
  147 :     while (flag==0){
  148 :         s1=0;
  149 :         s2=0;
  150 :         mxpast = mx;
  151 :         mypast = my;
  152 :         // Solving the weak form
  153 :         A = aa(Vh,Vh);
  154 :         F[] = ff(0,Vh);
  155 :         uh[] = A^-1*F[];
  156 :         hx = dx(uh);
  157 :         hy = dy(uh);
  158 :         // Computing energy for actual state
  159 :         E0= 0.5*int2d(Th)( hx*hx +hy*hy ); // Magnetostatic energy term
  160 :         for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  161 :         E0= E0 -V(i)*( mx(i)*h[0] +my(i)*h[1] ); // Zeeman energy term
  162 :         }
  163 :         // Computing the Gradient with respect m of each particle
  164 :         for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  165 :             Gradmx(i)= -int1d(Th,i)( uh*N.x ) -V(i)*h[0];
  166 :             Gradmy(i)= -int1d(Th,i)( uh*N.y ) -V(i)*h[1];
  167 :             gnorm= sqrt(Gradmx(i)^2.0 +Gradmy(i)^2.0);
  168 :             dirx= Gradmx(i)/gnorm;
  169 :             diry= Gradmy(i)/gnorm;
  170 :             // Moving the magnetization to the posterior state
  171 :             mx(i)= mx(i) -st*dirx +beta*randreal1();
  172 :             my(i)= my(i) -st*diry +beta*randreal1();
  173 :             mnorm= sqrt( mx(i)^2.0 +my(i)^2.0 );
  174 :             mx(i)= mx(i)/mnorm;
  175 :             my(i)= my(i)/mnorm;
  176 :         }
  177 :         //cout << "M_h"<< hi << "=" << mx(0) << "__" << my(0) <<"__" <<mx(0)^2 + my(0)^2 << endl;
  178 :         // Solving the weak form for the posterior state
  179 :         A= aa(Vh,Vh);
  180 :         F[]= ff(0,Vh);
  181 :         uh[]= A^-1*F[];
  182 :         hx= dx(uh); hy= dy(uh);
  183 :         // Computing energy for the posterior state
  184 :         E1= 0.5*int2d(Th)( hx*hx +hy*hy );
  185 :         for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  186 :         E1= E1 -V(i)*( mx(i)*h[0] +my(i)*h[1] );
  187 :         }
  188 :         dE= E0 -E1;
  189 :         if (E0 -E1 > 0){
  190 :             //cout << hi << "  OK  " << E0 << "\t" << E1 << "\t" <<
  191 :             //    mx(0) << "\t" << my(0) <<  endl;
  192 :             s1=1.0;
  193 :         }
  194 :         else{
  195 :             //cout << hi << "  Error  " << E0 << "\t" << E1 << "\t" <<
  196 :             //    mx(0) << "\t" << my(0) <<  endl;
  197 :             st= 0.5*st;
  198 :             mx= mxpast;
  199 :             my= mypast;
  200 :         }
  201 :         if (abs(dE) < 1e-8){
  202 :             s1=1.0;
  203 :         }
  204 :         if (abs(dE) < t){
  205 :             s2= 1.0;   
  206 :         }
  207 :         //cout << hi << "\t" << s1 << "\t" << dE << "\t" << s2 << endl;
  208 :         cout << "h=" <<hi << "	 E0=" << E0 << endl;
  209 :         if (s1*s2 >= 1){
  210 :             flag=1;
  211 :         }  
  212 :     }
  213 :     plot(uh ,value=1, wait=0, fill=1);
  214 :     mtotx=0.0;
  215 :     mtoty=0.0;
  216 :     for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  217 :         mtotx= mtotx +mx(i)*V(i)/Tvolume;
  218 :         mtoty= mtoty +my(i)*V(i)/Tvolume;
  219 :     }
  220 :     Ea= 0.5*int2d(Th)( hx*hx +hy*hy );
  221 :     for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  222 :     Ea= Ea -V(i)*( mx(i)*h[0] +my(i)*h[1] );
  223 :     }
  224 :     cout << "Energy minimum found for h=" << hi << endl;
  225 :     cout << "M=(" << mtotx << "," << mtoty << ")" << endl;
  226 :     cout << "E=" << Ea << endl;
  227 :     outfile << (h(0)) +"	"+ (h(1)) +"	"+ mtotx +"	"+ mtoty << endl;
  228 :     efile << Ea +"	" +mx(0) +"	" +my(0) << endl;
  229 :     it= it+1;
  230 :     hi = hi +dh;
  231 : }
  232 : 
  233 : //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  234 : // DOWNWARD CYCLE
  235 : //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  236 : 
  237 : hi= finalfield;
  238 : hf= initialfield;
  239 : dh= (hf-hi)/npoints;
  240 : //while (hi>hf){

    3 : entrada >> a0;
    4 : 
    5 : real phi = pi/2.0 - a0; // mant√©n esto si phi depende de a0
    6 : 
    7 : verbosity = 1;
    8 : real cpu = clock();
    9 : int seed = 123456789;
   10 : //randinit(100*clock());
   11 : 
   12 : /**
   13 : Variable Definitions
   14 : */
   15 : 
   16 : int npart = 1; //Number of particles
   17 : real boxwd = 20.0; // width of the cell containing the system
   18 : real boxht = 20.0; // height of the cell containing the system
   19 : real xradius = 1.0; // horizontal axis of the particles
   20 : real yradius = 2.0; // vertical axis of the particles
   21 : real xshift = 0.0; // horizontal shift from the center of the cell
   22 : real yshift = 0.0; // vertical shift form the center of the cell
   23 : //real a0 = 89.9*pi/180.0; // Tilt angle measured from +x axis. 
   24 : //real phi = pi/2.0 -a0; // angle between easy axis and external app field
   25 : real npoints = 57.0; //points in half the hysteresis curve
   26 : int mp = 50; // number of points in the mesh "meshpoints"
   27 : real beta = 3e-6; // constant to enter random variations
   28 : real t=1e-3; // tolerance for the code 
   29 : real initialfield = -5.0; // initial field
   30 : real finalfield = 5.0; // final (end) field
   31 : 
   32 : 
   33 : // real[int] is a vector of "int" elements. Each element is a real
   34 : real[int] mx(npart); //mx is vector storing horizontal magnetization
   35 : real[int] mxpast(npart); // mx in a past state for comparison
   36 : real[int] my(npart); //my is a vector storing vertical magnetization
   37 : real[int] mypast(npart); // my in a past state for comparison
   38 : real[int] V(npart); //V is a vector storing the volume of each particle
   39 : real[int] h(2); // vector storing the external magnetic field
   40 : real[int] Gradmx(2); // horizontal component of the Grad
   41 : real[int] Gradmy(2); // vertical component of the Grad 
   42 : real Tvolume; // Total volume 
   43 : real theta;
   44 : real hi; // auxiliar variable for external field
   45 : real hf; // auxiliar variable for external field
   46 : real dh; // Step to change the external field
   47 : real E0; // Energy in the actual system
   48 : real E1; // Energy in the state with proposed magnetization
   49 : real Ea; // Energy in the state with optimal magnetization for monitoring the energy
   50 : real gnorm; // Norm of the gradient
   51 : real mnorm; // Norm of the magnetization
   52 : real dirx; // Horizontal component of the normalized gradient
   53 : real diry; // Vertical component of the normalized gradient
   54 : real st; // step
   55 : real dE; // Energy difference
   56 : real mtotx; // total horizontal magnetization 
   57 : real mtoty; // total vertical magnetization
   58 : real it; // iteration counter
   59 : real flag; // Auxiliar variable that acts as a flag 
   60 : matrix A; // Matrix for the variational formulation
   61 : real s1; // Switch for conditionals
   62 : real s2; // Switch for conditionals
   63 : 
   64 : 
   65 : /**
   66 : Variables computed on the above
   67 : */
   68 : real xcenter= boxwd/2.0;
   69 : real ycenter= boxht/2.0;
   70 : 
   71 : /**
   72 : Filename generator
   73 : */
   74 : 
   75 : string name = "SW"+"X"+string(xradius)+"Y"+string(yradius)+"A"+string(phi*180.0/pi);
   76 : ofstream outfile(name+".txt");
   77 : //ofstream outfile("tester"+string(phi*180.0/pi)+".txt");
   78 : //ofstream outfile("tester.txt");
   79 : ofstream efile("Efile.txt");
   80 : 
   81 : /**
   82 : Space under construction
   83 : */
   84 : border b1(t=0.0,boxwd){x=t; y=0.0; label=901;};
   85 : border b2(t=0.0,boxht){x=boxwd; y=t; label=902;};
   86 : border b3(t=0.0,boxwd){x=boxwd-t; y=boxht; label=903;};
   87 : border b4(t=0.0,boxht){x=0.0; y=boxht-t; label=904;};
   88 : 
   89 : border B0(t=0, 2.0*pi){
   90 :   x= xcenter +xradius*cos(t)*cos(a0) -yradius*sin(t)*sin(a0) +xshift;
   91 :   y= ycenter +xradius*cos(t)*sin(a0) +yradius*sin(t)*cos(a0) +yshift;
   92 :   label=0;
   93 : };
   94 : 
   95 : mesh Th = buildmesh(b1(mp)+ b2(mp)+ b3(mp)+ b4(mp)+ B0(-mp) );
   96 : //plot(Th, wait=1);
   97 : 
   98 : // Auxiliar mesh to calculate the volume of each partile
   99 : // Make one for every particle in the volume count
  100 : mesh Thaux0 = buildmesh(B0(mp));
  101 : 
  102 : /**
  103 : Constructing the variational formulation and space functions
  104 : */
  105 : 
  106 : // Uncomment this section for periodic boundary conditions
  107 : /**
  108 : fespace Vh(Th, P1, periodic=[[901,x],[903,x],[902,y],[904,y]]);
  109 : Vh uh, vh, hx, hy, F;
  110 : varf aa(uh,vh)= int2d(Th)( dx(uh)*dx(vh) +dy(uh)*dy(vh) );
  111 : */
  112 : 
  113 : // Uncomment this section for Zero Boundary Conditions
  114 : fespace Vh(Th, P1);
  115 : Vh uh, vh, hx, hy, F; // Functions living in Vh
  116 : varf aa(uh,vh)= int2d(Th)( dx(uh)*dx(vh) +dy(uh)*dy(vh) ) 
  117 :                 +on(901,902,903,904, uh=0);
  118 : 
  119 : // add one int1d for each particle in the array
  120 : varf ff(unused, vh)= -int1d(Th,0)( (mx(0)*N.x +my(0)*N.y)*vh )
  121 :                      //-int1d(Th,1)( (mx(1)*N.x +my(1)*N.y)*vh )
  122 :                       ;
  123 : 
  124 : // Initiating magnetization. We also use this cicle to 
  125 : // compute the volume of the particles and the total volume
  126 : V(0)= int2d(Thaux0)(1.0);
  127 : Tvolume = 0.0;
  128 : 
  129 : for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  130 :     randinit( seed*clock() );
  131 :     theta= randreal2()*45.0*pi/180.0;
  132 :     mx(i)= cos(theta);
  133 :     my(i)= sin(theta);
  134 :     Tvolume= Tvolume +V(i);
  135 : }
  136 : cout << "M_initial=" << "	 mx=" << mx(0) << "	 my=" << my(0) << "	 m^2=" <<mx(0)^2 + my(0)^2 << endl;
  137 : 
  138 : hi= initialfield;
  139 : hf= finalfield;
  140 : dh = (hf-hi)/npoints;
  141 : while (hi<hf){
  142 :     h= [0.0,hi];
  143 :     flag=0;
  144 :     st=0.5;
  145 :     it=0;
  146 :     cout << "Getting the magnetization for h=" << hi << endl;
  147 :     while (flag==0){
  148 :         s1=0;
  149 :         s2=0;
  150 :         mxpast = mx;
  151 :         mypast = my;
  152 :         // Solving the weak form
  153 :         A = aa(Vh,Vh);
  154 :         F[] = ff(0,Vh);
  155 :         uh[] = A^-1*F[];
  156 :         hx = dx(uh);
  157 :         hy = dy(uh);
  158 :         // Computing energy for actual state
  159 :         E0= 0.5*int2d(Th)( hx*hx +hy*hy ); // Magnetostatic energy term
  160 :         for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  161 :         E0= E0 -V(i)*( mx(i)*h[0] +my(i)*h[1] ); // Zeeman energy term
  162 :         }
  163 :         // Computing the Gradient with respect m of each particle
  164 :         for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  165 :             Gradmx(i)= -int1d(Th,i)( uh*N.x ) -V(i)*h[0];
  166 :             Gradmy(i)= -int1d(Th,i)( uh*N.y ) -V(i)*h[1];
  167 :             gnorm= sqrt(Gradmx(i)^2.0 +Gradmy(i)^2.0);
  168 :             dirx= Gradmx(i)/gnorm;
  169 :             diry= Gradmy(i)/gnorm;
  170 :             // Moving the magnetization to the posterior state
  171 :             mx(i)= mx(i) -st*dirx +beta*randreal1();
  172 :             my(i)= my(i) -st*diry +beta*randreal1();
  173 :             mnorm= sqrt( mx(i)^2.0 +my(i)^2.0 );
  174 :             mx(i)= mx(i)/mnorm;
  175 :             my(i)= my(i)/mnorm;
  176 :         }
  177 :         //cout << "M_h"<< hi << "=" << mx(0) << "__" << my(0) <<"__" <<mx(0)^2 + my(0)^2 << endl;
  178 :         // Solving the weak form for the posterior state
  179 :         A= aa(Vh,Vh);
  180 :         F[]= ff(0,Vh);
  181 :         uh[]= A^-1*F[];
  182 :         hx= dx(uh); hy= dy(uh);
  183 :         // Computing energy for the posterior state
  184 :         E1= 0.5*int2d(Th)( hx*hx +hy*hy );
  185 :         for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  186 :         E1= E1 -V(i)*( mx(i)*h[0] +my(i)*h[1] );
  187 :         }
  188 :         dE= E0 -E1;
  189 :         if (E0 -E1 > 0){
  190 :             //cout << hi << "  OK  " << E0 << "\t" << E1 << "\t" <<
  191 :             //    mx(0) << "\t" << my(0) <<  endl;
  192 :             s1=1.0;
  193 :         }
  194 :         else{
  195 :             //cout << hi << "  Error  " << E0 << "\t" << E1 << "\t" <<
  196 :             //    mx(0) << "\t" << my(0) <<  endl;
  197 :             st= 0.5*st;
  198 :             mx= mxpast;
  199 :             my= mypast;
  200 :         }
  201 :         if (abs(dE) < 1e-8){
  202 :             s1=1.0;
  203 :         }
  204 :         if (abs(dE) < t){
  205 :             s2= 1.0;   
  206 :         }
  207 :         //cout << hi << "\t" << s1 << "\t" << dE << "\t" << s2 << endl;
  208 :         cout << "h=" <<hi << "	 E0=" << E0 << endl;
  209 :         if (s1*s2 >= 1){
  210 :             flag=1;
  211 :         }  
  212 :     }
  213 :     plot(uh ,value=1, wait=0, fill=1);
  214 :     mtotx=0.0;
  215 :     mtoty=0.0;
  216 :     for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  217 :         mtotx= mtotx +mx(i)*V(i)/Tvolume;
  218 :         mtoty= mtoty +my(i)*V(i)/Tvolume;
  219 :     }
  220 :     Ea= 0.5*int2d(Th)( hx*hx +hy*hy );
  221 :     for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  222 :     Ea= Ea -V(i)*( mx(i)*h[0] +my(i)*h[1] );
  223 :     }
  224 :     cout << "Energy minimum found for h=" << hi << endl;
  225 :     cout << "M=(" << mtotx << "," << mtoty << ")" << endl;
  226 :     cout << "E=" << Ea << endl;
  227 :     outfile << (h(0)) +"	"+ (h(1)) +"	"+ mtotx +"	"+ mtoty << endl;
  228 :     efile << Ea +"	" +mx(0) +"	" +my(0) << endl;
  229 :     it= it+1;
  230 :     hi = hi +dh;
  231 : }
  232 : 
  233 : //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  234 : // DOWNWARD CYCLE
  235 : //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  236 : 
  237 : hi= finalfield;
  238 : hf= initialfield;
  239 : dh= (hf-hi)/npoints;
  240 : //while (hi>hf){
  241 : while (hi>hf){
  242 :     h= [0.0,hi];
  243 :     flag=0;
  244 :     st=0.5;
  245 :     it=0;
  246 :     cout << "Getting the magnetization for h=" << hi << endl;
  247 :     while (flag==0){
  248 :         s1=0;
  249 :         s2=0;
  250 :         mxpast = mx;
  251 :         mypast = my;
  252 :         // Solving the weak form
  253 :         A = aa(Vh,Vh);
  254 :         F[] = ff(0,Vh);
  255 :         uh[] = A^-1*F[];
  256 :         hx = dx(uh);
  257 :         hy = dy(uh);
  258 :         // Computing energy for actual state
  259 :         E0= 0.5*int2d(Th)( hx*hx +hy*hy ); // Magnetostatic energy term
  260 :         for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  261 :         E0= E0 -V(i)*( mx(i)*h[0] +my(i)*h[1] ); // Zeeman energy term
  262 :         }
  263 :         // Computing the Gradient with respect m of each particle
  264 :         for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  265 :             Gradmx(i)= -int1d(Th,i)( uh*N.x ) -V(i)*h[0];
  266 :             Gradmy(i)= -int1d(Th,i)( uh*N.y ) -V(i)*h[1];
  267 :             gnorm= sqrt(Gradmx(i)^2.0 +Gradmy(i)^2.0);
  268 :             dirx= Gradmx(i)/gnorm;
  269 :             diry= Gradmy(i)/gnorm;
  270 :             // Moving the magnetization to the posterior state
  271 :             mx(i)= mx(i) -st*dirx +beta*randreal1();
  272 :             my(i)= my(i) -st*diry +beta*randreal1();
  273 :             mnorm= sqrt( mx(i)^2.0 +my(i)^2.0 );
  274 :             mx(i)= mx(i)/mnorm;
  275 :             my(i)= my(i)/mnorm;
  276 :         }
  277 :         //cout << "M_h"<< hi << "=" << mx(0) << "__" << my(0) <<"__" <<mx(0)^2 + my(0)^2 << endl;
  278 :         // Solving the weak form for the posterior state
  279 :         A= aa(Vh,Vh);
  280 :         F[]= ff(0,Vh);
  281 :         uh[]= A^-1*F[];
  282 :         hx= dx(uh); hy= dy(uh);
  283 :         // Computing energy for the posterior state
  284 :         E1= 0.5*int2d(Th)( hx*hx +hy*hy );
  285 :         for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  286 :         E1= E1 -V(i)*( mx(i)*h[0] +my(i)*h[1] );
  287 :         }
  288 :         dE= E0 -E1;
  289 :         if (E0 -E1 > 0){
  290 :             //cout << hi << "  OK  " << E0 << "\t" << E1 << "\t" <<
  291 :             //    mx(0) << "\t" << my(0) <<  endl;
  292 :             s1=1.0;
  293 :         }
  294 :         else{
  295 :             //cout << hi << "  Error  " << E0 << "\t" << E1 << "\t" <<
  296 :             //    mx(0) << "\t" << my(0) <<  endl;
  297 :             st= 0.5*st;
  298 :             mx= mxpast;
  299 :             my= mypast;
  300 :         }
  301 :         if (abs(dE) < 1e-8){
  302 :             s1=1.0;
  303 :         }
  304 :         if (abs(dE) < t){
  305 :             s2= 1.0;   
  306 :         }
  307 :         //cout << hi << "\t" << s1 << "\t" << dE << "\t" << s2 << endl;
  308 :         cout << "h=" <<hi << "	 E0=" << E0 << endl;
  309 :         if (s1*s2 >= 1){
  310 :             flag=1;
  311 :         }

  313 :     plot(uh ,value=1, wait=0, fill=1);

    3 : entrada >> a0;
    4 : 
    5 : real phi = pi/2.0 - a0; // mant√©n esto si phi depende de a0
    6 : 
    7 : verbosity = 1;
    8 : real cpu = clock();
    9 : int seed = 123456789;
   10 : //randinit(100*clock());
   11 : 
   12 : /**
   13 : Variable Definitions
   14 : */
   15 : 
   16 : int npart = 1; //Number of particles
   17 : real boxwd = 20.0; // width of the cell containing the system
   18 : real boxht = 20.0; // height of the cell containing the system
   19 : real xradius = 1.0; // horizontal axis of the particles
   20 : real yradius = 2.0; // vertical axis of the particles
   21 : real xshift = 0.0; // horizontal shift from the center of the cell
   22 : real yshift = 0.0; // vertical shift form the center of the cell
   23 : //real a0 = 89.9*pi/180.0; // Tilt angle measured from +x axis. 
   24 : //real phi = pi/2.0 -a0; // angle between easy axis and external app field
   25 : real npoints = 57.0; //points in half the hysteresis curve
   26 : int mp = 50; // number of points in the mesh "meshpoints"
   27 : real beta = 3e-6; // constant to enter random variations
   28 : real t=1e-3; // tolerance for the code 
   29 : real initialfield = -5.0; // initial field
   30 : real finalfield = 5.0; // final (end) field
   31 : 
   32 : 
   33 : // real[int] is a vector of "int" elements. Each element is a real
   34 : real[int] mx(npart); //mx is vector storing horizontal magnetization
   35 : real[int] mxpast(npart); // mx in a past state for comparison
   36 : real[int] my(npart); //my is a vector storing vertical magnetization
   37 : real[int] mypast(npart); // my in a past state for comparison
   38 : real[int] V(npart); //V is a vector storing the volume of each particle
   39 : real[int] h(2); // vector storing the external magnetic field
   40 : real[int] Gradmx(2); // horizontal component of the Grad
   41 : real[int] Gradmy(2); // vertical component of the Grad 
   42 : real Tvolume; // Total volume 
   43 : real theta;
   44 : real hi; // auxiliar variable for external field
   45 : real hf; // auxiliar variable for external field
   46 : real dh; // Step to change the external field
   47 : real E0; // Energy in the actual system
   48 : real E1; // Energy in the state with proposed magnetization
   49 : real Ea; // Energy in the state with optimal magnetization for monitoring the energy
   50 : real gnorm; // Norm of the gradient
   51 : real mnorm; // Norm of the magnetization
   52 : real dirx; // Horizontal component of the normalized gradient
   53 : real diry; // Vertical component of the normalized gradient
   54 : real st; // step
   55 : real dE; // Energy difference
   56 : real mtotx; // total horizontal magnetization 
   57 : real mtoty; // total vertical magnetization
   58 : real it; // iteration counter
   59 : real flag; // Auxiliar variable that acts as a flag 
   60 : matrix A; // Matrix for the variational formulation
   61 : real s1; // Switch for conditionals
   62 : real s2; // Switch for conditionals
   63 : 
   64 : 
   65 : /**
   66 : Variables computed on the above
   67 : */
   68 : real xcenter= boxwd/2.0;
   69 : real ycenter= boxht/2.0;
   70 : 
   71 : /**
   72 : Filename generator
   73 : */
   74 : 
   75 : string name = "SW"+"X"+string(xradius)+"Y"+string(yradius)+"A"+string(phi*180.0/pi);
   76 : ofstream outfile(name+".txt");
   77 : //ofstream outfile("tester"+string(phi*180.0/pi)+".txt");
   78 : //ofstream outfile("tester.txt");
   79 : ofstream efile("Efile.txt");
   80 : 
   81 : /**
   82 : Space under construction
   83 : */
   84 : border b1(t=0.0,boxwd){x=t; y=0.0; label=901;};
   85 : border b2(t=0.0,boxht){x=boxwd; y=t; label=902;};
   86 : border b3(t=0.0,boxwd){x=boxwd-t; y=boxht; label=903;};
   87 : border b4(t=0.0,boxht){x=0.0; y=boxht-t; label=904;};
   88 : 
   89 : border B0(t=0, 2.0*pi){
   90 :   x= xcenter +xradius*cos(t)*cos(a0) -yradius*sin(t)*sin(a0) +xshift;
   91 :   y= ycenter +xradius*cos(t)*sin(a0) +yradius*sin(t)*cos(a0) +yshift;
   92 :   label=0;
   93 : };
   94 : 
   95 : mesh Th = buildmesh(b1(mp)+ b2(mp)+ b3(mp)+ b4(mp)+ B0(-mp) );
   96 : //plot(Th, wait=1);
   97 : 
   98 : // Auxiliar mesh to calculate the volume of each partile
   99 : // Make one for every particle in the volume count
  100 : mesh Thaux0 = buildmesh(B0(mp));
  101 : 
  102 : /**
  103 : Constructing the variational formulation and space functions
  104 : */
  105 : 
  106 : // Uncomment this section for periodic boundary conditions
  107 : /**
  108 : fespace Vh(Th, P1, periodic=[[901,x],[903,x],[902,y],[904,y]]);
  109 : Vh uh, vh, hx, hy, F;
  110 : varf aa(uh,vh)= int2d(Th)( dx(uh)*dx(vh) +dy(uh)*dy(vh) );
  111 : */
  112 : 
  113 : // Uncomment this section for Zero Boundary Conditions
  114 : fespace Vh(Th, P1);
  115 : Vh uh, vh, hx, hy, F; // Functions living in Vh
  116 : varf aa(uh,vh)= int2d(Th)( dx(uh)*dx(vh) +dy(uh)*dy(vh) ) 
  117 :                 +on(901,902,903,904, uh=0);
  118 : 
  119 : // add one int1d for each particle in the array
  120 : varf ff(unused, vh)= -int1d(Th,0)( (mx(0)*N.x +my(0)*N.y)*vh )
  121 :                      //-int1d(Th,1)( (mx(1)*N.x +my(1)*N.y)*vh )
  122 :                       ;
  123 : 
  124 : // Initiating magnetization. We also use this cicle to 
  125 : // compute the volume of the particles and the total volume
  126 : V(0)= int2d(Thaux0)(1.0);
  127 : Tvolume = 0.0;
  128 : 
  129 : for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  130 :     randinit( seed*clock() );
  131 :     theta= randreal2()*45.0*pi/180.0;
  132 :     mx(i)= cos(theta);
  133 :     my(i)= sin(theta);
  134 :     Tvolume= Tvolume +V(i);
  135 : }
  136 : cout << "M_initial=" << "	 mx=" << mx(0) << "	 my=" << my(0) << "	 m^2=" <<mx(0)^2 + my(0)^2 << endl;
  137 : 
  138 : hi= initialfield;
  139 : hf= finalfield;
  140 : dh = (hf-hi)/npoints;
  141 : while (hi<hf){
  142 :     h= [0.0,hi];
  143 :     flag=0;
  144 :     st=0.5;
  145 :     it=0;
  146 :     cout << "Getting the magnetization for h=" << hi << endl;
  147 :     while (flag==0){
  148 :         s1=0;
  149 :         s2=0;
  150 :         mxpast = mx;
  151 :         mypast = my;
  152 :         // Solving the weak form
  153 :         A = aa(Vh,Vh);
  154 :         F[] = ff(0,Vh);
  155 :         uh[] = A^-1*F[];
  156 :         hx = dx(uh);
  157 :         hy = dy(uh);
  158 :         // Computing energy for actual state
  159 :         E0= 0.5*int2d(Th)( hx*hx +hy*hy ); // Magnetostatic energy term
  160 :         for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  161 :         E0= E0 -V(i)*( mx(i)*h[0] +my(i)*h[1] ); // Zeeman energy term
  162 :         }
  163 :         // Computing the Gradient with respect m of each particle
  164 :         for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  165 :             Gradmx(i)= -int1d(Th,i)( uh*N.x ) -V(i)*h[0];
  166 :             Gradmy(i)= -int1d(Th,i)( uh*N.y ) -V(i)*h[1];
  167 :             gnorm= sqrt(Gradmx(i)^2.0 +Gradmy(i)^2.0);
  168 :             dirx= Gradmx(i)/gnorm;
  169 :             diry= Gradmy(i)/gnorm;
  170 :             // Moving the magnetization to the posterior state
  171 :             mx(i)= mx(i) -st*dirx +beta*randreal1();
  172 :             my(i)= my(i) -st*diry +beta*randreal1();
  173 :             mnorm= sqrt( mx(i)^2.0 +my(i)^2.0 );
  174 :             mx(i)= mx(i)/mnorm;
  175 :             my(i)= my(i)/mnorm;
  176 :         }
  177 :         //cout << "M_h"<< hi << "=" << mx(0) << "__" << my(0) <<"__" <<mx(0)^2 + my(0)^2 << endl;
  178 :         // Solving the weak form for the posterior state
  179 :         A= aa(Vh,Vh);
  180 :         F[]= ff(0,Vh);
  181 :         uh[]= A^-1*F[];
  182 :         hx= dx(uh); hy= dy(uh);
  183 :         // Computing energy for the posterior state
  184 :         E1= 0.5*int2d(Th)( hx*hx +hy*hy );
  185 :         for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  186 :         E1= E1 -V(i)*( mx(i)*h[0] +my(i)*h[1] );
  187 :         }
  188 :         dE= E0 -E1;
  189 :         if (E0 -E1 > 0){
  190 :             //cout << hi << "  OK  " << E0 << "\t" << E1 << "\t" <<
  191 :             //    mx(0) << "\t" << my(0) <<  endl;
  192 :             s1=1.0;
  193 :         }
  194 :         else{
  195 :             //cout << hi << "  Error  " << E0 << "\t" << E1 << "\t" <<
  196 :             //    mx(0) << "\t" << my(0) <<  endl;
  197 :             st= 0.5*st;
  198 :             mx= mxpast;
  199 :             my= mypast;
  200 :         }
  201 :         if (abs(dE) < 1e-8){
  202 :             s1=1.0;
  203 :         }
  204 :         if (abs(dE) < t){
  205 :             s2= 1.0;   
  206 :         }
  207 :         //cout << hi << "\t" << s1 << "\t" << dE << "\t" << s2 << endl;
  208 :         cout << "h=" <<hi << "	 E0=" << E0 << endl;
  209 :         if (s1*s2 >= 1){
  210 :             flag=1;
  211 :         }  
  212 :     }
  213 :     plot(uh ,value=1, wait=0, fill=1);
  214 :     mtotx=0.0;
  215 :     mtoty=0.0;
  216 :     for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  217 :         mtotx= mtotx +mx(i)*V(i)/Tvolume;
  218 :         mtoty= mtoty +my(i)*V(i)/Tvolume;
  219 :     }
  220 :     Ea= 0.5*int2d(Th)( hx*hx +hy*hy );
  221 :     for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  222 :     Ea= Ea -V(i)*( mx(i)*h[0] +my(i)*h[1] );
  223 :     }
  224 :     cout << "Energy minimum found for h=" << hi << endl;
  225 :     cout << "M=(" << mtotx << "," << mtoty << ")" << endl;
  226 :     cout << "E=" << Ea << endl;
  227 :     outfile << (h(0)) +"	"+ (h(1)) +"	"+ mtotx +"	"+ mtoty << endl;
  228 :     efile << Ea +"	" +mx(0) +"	" +my(0) << endl;
  229 :     it= it+1;
  230 :     hi = hi +dh;
  231 : }
  232 : 
  233 : //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  234 : // DOWNWARD CYCLE
  235 : //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  236 : 
  237 : hi= finalfield;
  238 : hf= initialfield;
  239 : dh= (hf-hi)/npoints;
  240 : //while (hi>hf){
  241 : while (hi>hf){
  242 :     h= [0.0,hi];
  243 :     flag=0;
  244 :     st=0.5;
  245 :     it=0;
  246 :     cout << "Getting the magnetization for h=" << hi << endl;
  247 :     while (flag==0){
  248 :         s1=0;
  249 :         s2=0;
  250 :         mxpast = mx;
  251 :         mypast = my;
  252 :         // Solving the weak form
  253 :         A = aa(Vh,Vh);
  254 :         F[] = ff(0,Vh);
  255 :         uh[] = A^-1*F[];
  256 :         hx = dx(uh);
  257 :         hy = dy(uh);
  258 :         // Computing energy for actual state
  259 :         E0= 0.5*int2d(Th)( hx*hx +hy*hy ); // Magnetostatic energy term
  260 :         for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  261 :         E0= E0 -V(i)*( mx(i)*h[0] +my(i)*h[1] ); // Zeeman energy term
  262 :         }
  263 :         // Computing the Gradient with respect m of each particle
  264 :         for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  265 :             Gradmx(i)= -int1d(Th,i)( uh*N.x ) -V(i)*h[0];
  266 :             Gradmy(i)= -int1d(Th,i)( uh*N.y ) -V(i)*h[1];
  267 :             gnorm= sqrt(Gradmx(i)^2.0 +Gradmy(i)^2.0);
  268 :             dirx= Gradmx(i)/gnorm;
  269 :             diry= Gradmy(i)/gnorm;
  270 :             // Moving the magnetization to the posterior state
  271 :             mx(i)= mx(i) -st*dirx +beta*randreal1();
  272 :             my(i)= my(i) -st*diry +beta*randreal1();
  273 :             mnorm= sqrt( mx(i)^2.0 +my(i)^2.0 );
  274 :             mx(i)= mx(i)/mnorm;
  275 :             my(i)= my(i)/mnorm;
  276 :         }
  277 :         //cout << "M_h"<< hi << "=" << mx(0) << "__" << my(0) <<"__" <<mx(0)^2 + my(0)^2 << endl;
  278 :         // Solving the weak form for the posterior state
  279 :         A= aa(Vh,Vh);
  280 :         F[]= ff(0,Vh);
  281 :         uh[]= A^-1*F[];
  282 :         hx= dx(uh); hy= dy(uh);
  283 :         // Computing energy for the posterior state
  284 :         E1= 0.5*int2d(Th)( hx*hx +hy*hy );
  285 :         for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  286 :         E1= E1 -V(i)*( mx(i)*h[0] +my(i)*h[1] );
  287 :         }
  288 :         dE= E0 -E1;
  289 :         if (E0 -E1 > 0){
  290 :             //cout << hi << "  OK  " << E0 << "\t" << E1 << "\t" <<
  291 :             //    mx(0) << "\t" << my(0) <<  endl;
  292 :             s1=1.0;
  293 :         }
  294 :         else{
  295 :             //cout << hi << "  Error  " << E0 << "\t" << E1 << "\t" <<
  296 :             //    mx(0) << "\t" << my(0) <<  endl;
  297 :             st= 0.5*st;
  298 :             mx= mxpast;
  299 :             my= mypast;
  300 :         }
  301 :         if (abs(dE) < 1e-8){
  302 :             s1=1.0;
  303 :         }
  304 :         if (abs(dE) < t){
  305 :             s2= 1.0;   
  306 :         }
  307 :         //cout << hi << "\t" << s1 << "\t" << dE << "\t" << s2 << endl;
  308 :         cout << "h=" <<hi << "	 E0=" << E0 << endl;
  309 :         if (s1*s2 >= 1){
  310 :             flag=1;
  311 :         }

  313 :     plot(uh ,value=1, wait=0, fill=1);
  314 :     mtotx=0.0;

-- FreeFem++ v4.15 (Wed Dec 11 16:48:56 CET 2024 - git v4.15-7-gb1e524c8c)
   file : StonerW.edp
 Load: lg_fem lg_mesh lg_mesh3 eigenvalue 
    1 : real a0;
    2 : ifstream entrada("input_a0.txt");
    3 : entrada >> a0;
    4 : 
    5 : real phi = pi/2.0 - a0; // mant√©n esto si phi depende de a0
    6 : 
    7 : verbosity = 1;
    8 : real cpu = clock();
    9 : int seed = 123456789;
   10 : //randinit(100*clock());
   11 : 
   12 : /**
   13 : Variable Definitions
   14 : */
   15 : 
   16 : int npart = 1; //Number of particles
   17 : real boxwd = 20.0; // width of the cell containing the system
   18 : real boxht = 20.0; // height of the cell containing the system
   19 : real xradius = 1.0; // horizontal axis of the particles
   20 : real yradius = 2.0; // vertical axis of the particles
   21 : real xshift = 0.0; // horizontal shift from the center of the cell
   22 : real yshift = 0.0; // vertical shift form the center of the cell
   23 : //real a0 = 89.9*pi/180.0; // Tilt angle measured from +x axis. 
   24 : //real phi = pi/2.0 -a0; // angle between easy axis and external app field
   25 : real npoints = 57.0; //points in half the hysteresis curve
   26 : int mp = 50; // number of points in the mesh "meshpoints"
   27 : real beta = 3e-6; // constant to enter random variations
   28 : real t=1e-3; // tolerance for the code 
   29 : real initialfield = -5.0; // initial field
   30 : real finalfield = 5.0; // final (end) field
   31 : 
   32 : 
   33 : // real[int] is a vector of "int" elements. Each element is a real
   34 : real[int] mx(npart); //mx is vector storing horizontal magnetization
   35 : real[int] mxpast(npart); // mx in a past state for comparison
   36 : real[int] my(npart); //my is a vector storing vertical magnetization
   37 : real[int] mypast(npart); // my in a past state for comparison
   38 : real[int] V(npart); //V is a vector storing the volume of each particle
   39 : real[int] h(2); // vector storing the external magnetic field
   40 : real[int] Gradmx(2); // horizontal component of the Grad
   41 : real[int] Gradmy(2); // vertical component of the Grad 
   42 : real Tvolume; // Total volume 
   43 : real theta;
   44 : real hi; // auxiliar variable for external field
   45 : real hf; // auxiliar variable for external field
   46 : real dh; // Step to change the external field
   47 : real E0; // Energy in the actual system
   48 : real E1; // Energy in the state with proposed magnetization
   49 : real Ea; // Energy in the state with optimal magnetization for monitoring the energy
   50 : real gnorm; // Norm of the gradient
   51 : real mnorm; // Norm of the magnetization
   52 : real dirx; // Horizontal component of the normalized gradient
   53 : real diry; // Vertical component of the normalized gradient
   54 : real st; // step
   55 : real dE; // Energy difference
   56 : real mtotx; // total horizontal magnetization 
   57 : real mtoty; // total vertical magnetization
   58 : real it; // iteration counter
   59 : real flag; // Auxiliar variable that acts as a flag 
   60 : matrix A; // Matrix for the variational formulation
   61 : real s1; // Switch for conditionals
   62 : real s2; // Switch for conditionals
   63 : 
   64 : 
   65 : /**
   66 : Variables computed on the above
   67 : */
   68 : real xcenter= boxwd/2.0;
   69 : real ycenter= boxht/2.0;
   70 : 
   71 : /**
   72 : Filename generator
   73 : */
   74 : 
   75 : string name = "SW"+"X"+string(xradius)+"Y"+string(yradius)+"A"+string(phi*180.0/pi);
   76 : ofstream outfile(name+".txt");
   77 : //ofstream outfile("tester"+string(phi*180.0/pi)+".txt");
   78 : //ofstream outfile("tester.txt");
   79 : ofstream efile("Efile.txt");
   80 : 
   81 : /**
   82 : Space under construction
   83 : */
   84 : border b1(t=0.0,boxwd){x=t; y=0.0; label=901;};
   85 : border b2(t=0.0,boxht){x=boxwd; y=t; label=902;};
   86 : border b3(t=0.0,boxwd){x=boxwd-t; y=boxht; label=903;};
   87 : border b4(t=0.0,boxht){x=0.0; y=boxht-t; label=904;};
   88 : 
   89 : border B0(t=0, 2.0*pi){
   90 :   x= xcenter +xradius*cos(t)*cos(a0) -yradius*sin(t)*sin(a0) +xshift;
   91 :   y= ycenter +xradius*cos(t)*sin(a0) +yradius*sin(t)*cos(a0) +yshift;
   92 :   label=0;
   93 : };
   94 : 
   95 : mesh Th = buildmesh(b1(mp)+ b2(mp)+ b3(mp)+ b4(mp)+ B0(-mp) );
   96 : //plot(Th, wait=1);
   97 : 
   98 : // Auxiliar mesh to calculate the volume of each partile
   99 : // Make one for every particle in the volume count
  100 : mesh Thaux0 = buildmesh(B0(mp));
  101 : 
  102 : /**
  103 : Constructing the variational formulation and space functions
  104 : */
  105 : 
  106 : // Uncomment this section for periodic boundary conditions
  107 : /**
  108 : fespace Vh(Th, P1, periodic=[[901,x],[903,x],[902,y],[904,y]]);
  109 : Vh uh, vh, hx, hy, F;
  110 : varf aa(uh,vh)= int2d(Th)( dx(uh)*dx(vh) +dy(uh)*dy(vh) );
  111 : */
  112 : 
  113 : // Uncomment this section for Zero Boundary Conditions
  114 : fespace Vh(Th, P1);
  115 : Vh uh, vh, hx, hy, F; // Functions living in Vh
  116 : varf aa(uh,vh)= int2d(Th)( dx(uh)*dx(vh) +dy(uh)*dy(vh) ) 
  117 :                 +on(901,902,903,904, uh=0);
  118 : 
  119 : // add one int1d for each particle in the array
  120 : varf ff(unused, vh)= -int1d(Th,0)( (mx(0)*N.x +my(0)*N.y)*vh )
  121 :                      //-int1d(Th,1)( (mx(1)*N.x +my(1)*N.y)*vh )
  122 :                       ;
  123 : 
  124 : // Initiating magnetization. We also use this cicle to 
  125 : // compute the volume of the particles and the total volume
  126 : V(0)= int2d(Thaux0)(1.0);
  127 : Tvolume = 0.0;
  128 : 
  129 : for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  130 :     randinit( seed*clock() );
  131 :     theta= randreal2()*45.0*pi/180.0;
  132 :     mx(i)= cos(theta);
  133 :     my(i)= sin(theta);
  134 :     Tvolume= Tvolume +V(i);
  135 : }
  136 : cout << "M_initial=" << "	 mx=" << mx(0) << "	 my=" << my(0) << "	 m^2=" <<mx(0)^2 + my(0)^2 << endl;
  137 : 
  138 : hi= initialfield;
  139 : hf= finalfield;
  140 : dh = (hf-hi)/npoints;
  141 : while (hi<hf){
  142 :     h= [0.0,hi];
  143 :     flag=0;
  144 :     st=0.5;
  145 :     it=0;
  146 :     cout << "Getting the magnetization for h=" << hi << endl;
  147 :     while (flag==0){
  148 :         s1=0;
  149 :         s2=0;
  150 :         mxpast = mx;
  151 :         mypast = my;
  152 :         // Solving the weak form
  153 :         A = aa(Vh,Vh);
  154 :         F[] = ff(0,Vh);
  155 :         uh[] = A^-1*F[];
  156 :         hx = dx(uh);
  157 :         hy = dy(uh);
  158 :         // Computing energy for actual state
  159 :         E0= 0.5*int2d(Th)( hx*hx +hy*hy ); // Magnetostatic energy term
  160 :         for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  161 :         E0= E0 -V(i)*( mx(i)*h[0] +my(i)*h[1] ); // Zeeman energy term
  162 :         }
  163 :         // Computing the Gradient with respect m of each particle
  164 :         for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  165 :             Gradmx(i)= -int1d(Th,i)( uh*N.x ) -V(i)*h[0];
  166 :             Gradmy(i)= -int1d(Th,i)( uh*N.y ) -V(i)*h[1];
  167 :             gnorm= sqrt(Gradmx(i)^2.0 +Gradmy(i)^2.0);
  168 :             dirx= Gradmx(i)/gnorm;
  169 :             diry= Gradmy(i)/gnorm;
  170 :             // Moving the magnetization to the posterior state
  171 :             mx(i)= mx(i) -st*dirx +beta*randreal1();
  172 :             my(i)= my(i) -st*diry +beta*randreal1();
  173 :             mnorm= sqrt( mx(i)^2.0 +my(i)^2.0 );
  174 :             mx(i)= mx(i)/mnorm;
  175 :             my(i)= my(i)/mnorm;
  176 :         }
  177 :         //cout << "M_h"<< hi << "=" << mx(0) << "__" << my(0) <<"__" <<mx(0)^2 + my(0)^2 << endl;
  178 :         // Solving the weak form for the posterior state
  179 :         A= aa(Vh,Vh);
  180 :         F[]= ff(0,Vh);
  181 :         uh[]= A^-1*F[];
  182 :         hx= dx(uh); hy= dy(uh);
  183 :         // Computing energy for the posterior state
  184 :         E1= 0.5*int2d(Th)( hx*hx +hy*hy );
  185 :         for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  186 :         E1= E1 -V(i)*( mx(i)*h[0] +my(i)*h[1] );
  187 :         }
  188 :         dE= E0 -E1;
  189 :         if (E0 -E1 > 0){
  190 :             //cout << hi << "  OK  " << E0 << "\t" << E1 << "\t" <<
  191 :             //    mx(0) << "\t" << my(0) <<  endl;
  192 :             s1=1.0;
  193 :         }
  194 :         else{
  195 :             //cout << hi << "  Error  " << E0 << "\t" << E1 << "\t" <<
  196 :             //    mx(0) << "\t" << my(0) <<  endl;
  197 :             st= 0.5*st;
  198 :             mx= mxpast;
  199 :             my= mypast;
  200 :         }
  201 :         if (abs(dE) < 1e-8){
  202 :             s1=1.0;
  203 :         }
  204 :         if (abs(dE) < t){
  205 :             s2= 1.0;   
  206 :         }
  207 :         //cout << hi << "\t" << s1 << "\t" << dE << "\t" << s2 << endl;
  208 :         cout << "h=" <<hi << "	 E0=" << E0 << endl;
  209 :         if (s1*s2 >= 1){
  210 :             flag=1;
  211 :         }  
  212 :     }
  213 :     plot(uh ,value=1, wait=0, fill=1);
  214 :     mtotx=0.0;
  215 :     mtoty=0.0;
  216 :     for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  217 :         mtotx= mtotx +mx(i)*V(i)/Tvolume;
  218 :         mtoty= mtoty +my(i)*V(i)/Tvolume;
  219 :     }
  220 :     Ea= 0.5*int2d(Th)( hx*hx +hy*hy );
  221 :     for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  222 :     Ea= Ea -V(i)*( mx(i)*h[0] +my(i)*h[1] );
  223 :     }
  224 :     cout << "Energy minimum found for h=" << hi << endl;
  225 :     cout << "M=(" << mtotx << "," << mtoty << ")" << endl;
  226 :     cout << "E=" << Ea << endl;
  227 :     outfile << (h(0)) +"	"+ (h(1)) +"	"+ mtotx +"	"+ mtoty << endl;
  228 :     efile << Ea +"	" +mx(0) +"	" +my(0) << endl;
  229 :     it= it+1;
  230 :     hi = hi +dh;
  231 : }
  232 : 
  233 : //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  234 : // DOWNWARD CYCLE
  235 : //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  236 : 
  237 : hi= finalfield;
  238 : hf= initialfield;
  239 : dh= (hf-hi)/npoints;
  240 : //while (hi>hf){

  242 :     h= [0.0,hi];

  247 :     while (flag==0){

  252 :         // Solving the weak form

  272 :             my(i)= my(i) -st*diry +beta*randreal1();

-- FreeFem++ v4.15 (Wed Dec 11 16:48:56 CET 2024 - git v4.15-7-gb1e524c8c)
   file : StonerW.edp
 Load: lg_fem lg_mesh lg_mesh3 eigenvalue 
    1 : real a0;
    2 : ifstream entrada("input_a0.txt");
    3 : entrada >> a0;
    4 : 
    5 : real phi = pi/2.0 - a0; // mant√©n esto si phi depende de a0
    6 : 
    7 : verbosity = 1;
    8 : real cpu = clock();
    9 : int seed = 123456789;
   10 : //randinit(100*clock());
   11 : 
   12 : /**
   13 : Variable Definitions
   14 : */
   15 : 
   16 : int npart = 1; //Number of particles
   17 : real boxwd = 20.0; // width of the cell containing the system
   18 : real boxht = 20.0; // height of the cell containing the system
   19 : real xradius = 1.0; // horizontal axis of the particles
   20 : real yradius = 2.0; // vertical axis of the particles
   21 : real xshift = 0.0; // horizontal shift from the center of the cell
   22 : real yshift = 0.0; // vertical shift form the center of the cell
   23 : //real a0 = 89.9*pi/180.0; // Tilt angle measured from +x axis. 
   24 : //real phi = pi/2.0 -a0; // angle between easy axis and external app field
   25 : real npoints = 57.0; //points in half the hysteresis curve
   26 : int mp = 50; // number of points in the mesh "meshpoints"
   27 : real beta = 3e-6; // constant to enter random variations
   28 : real t=1e-3; // tolerance for the code 
   29 : real initialfield = -5.0; // initial field
   30 : real finalfield = 5.0; // final (end) field
   31 : 
   32 : 
   33 : // real[int] is a vector of "int" elements. Each element is a real
   34 : real[int] mx(npart); //mx is vector storing horizontal magnetization
   35 : real[int] mxpast(npart); // mx in a past state for comparison
   36 : real[int] my(npart); //my is a vector storing vertical magnetization
   37 : real[int] mypast(npart); // my in a past state for comparison
   38 : real[int] V(npart); //V is a vector storing the volume of each particle
   39 : real[int] h(2); // vector storing the external magnetic field
   40 : real[int] Gradmx(2); // horizontal component of the Grad
   41 : real[int] Gradmy(2); // vertical component of the Grad 
   42 : real Tvolume; // Total volume 
   43 : real theta;
   44 : real hi; // auxiliar variable for external field
   45 : real hf; // auxiliar variable for external field
   46 : real dh; // Step to change the external field
   47 : real E0; // Energy in the actual system
   48 : real E1; // Energy in the state with proposed magnetization
   49 : real Ea; // Energy in the state with optimal magnetization for monitoring the energy
   50 : real gnorm; // Norm of the gradient
   51 : real mnorm; // Norm of the magnetization
   52 : real dirx; // Horizontal component of the normalized gradient
   53 : real diry; // Vertical component of the normalized gradient
   54 : real st; // step
   55 : real dE; // Energy difference
   56 : real mtotx; // total horizontal magnetization 
   57 : real mtoty; // total vertical magnetization
   58 : real it; // iteration counter
   59 : real flag; // Auxiliar variable that acts as a flag 
   60 : matrix A; // Matrix for the variational formulation
   61 : real s1; // Switch for conditionals
   62 : real s2; // Switch for conditionals
   63 : 
   64 : 
   65 : /**
   66 : Variables computed on the above
   67 : */
   68 : real xcenter= boxwd/2.0;
   69 : real ycenter= boxht/2.0;
   70 : 
   71 : /**
   72 : Filename generator
   73 : */
   74 : 
   75 : string name = "SW"+"X"+string(xradius)+"Y"+string(yradius)+"A"+string(phi*180.0/pi);
   76 : ofstream outfile(name+".txt");
   77 : //ofstream outfile("tester"+string(phi*180.0/pi)+".txt");
   78 : //ofstream outfile("tester.txt");
   79 : ofstream efile("Efile.txt");
   80 : 
   81 : /**
   82 : Space under construction
   83 : */
   84 : border b1(t=0.0,boxwd){x=t; y=0.0; label=901;};
   85 : border b2(t=0.0,boxht){x=boxwd; y=t; label=902;};
   86 : border b3(t=0.0,boxwd){x=boxwd-t; y=boxht; label=903;};
   87 : border b4(t=0.0,boxht){x=0.0; y=boxht-t; label=904;};
   88 : 
   89 : border B0(t=0, 2.0*pi){
   90 :   x= xcenter +xradius*cos(t)*cos(a0) -yradius*sin(t)*sin(a0) +xshift;
   91 :   y= ycenter +xradius*cos(t)*sin(a0) +yradius*sin(t)*cos(a0) +yshift;
   92 :   label=0;
   93 : };
   94 : 
   95 : mesh Th = buildmesh(b1(mp)+ b2(mp)+ b3(mp)+ b4(mp)+ B0(-mp) );
   96 : //plot(Th, wait=1);
   97 : 
   98 : // Auxiliar mesh to calculate the volume of each partile
   99 : // Make one for every particle in the volume count
  100 : mesh Thaux0 = buildmesh(B0(mp));
  101 : 
  102 : /**
  103 : Constructing the variational formulation and space functions
  104 : */
  105 : 
  106 : // Uncomment this section for periodic boundary conditions
  107 : /**
  108 : fespace Vh(Th, P1, periodic=[[901,x],[903,x],[902,y],[904,y]]);
  109 : Vh uh, vh, hx, hy, F;
  110 : varf aa(uh,vh)= int2d(Th)( dx(uh)*dx(vh) +dy(uh)*dy(vh) );
  111 : */
  112 : 
  113 : // Uncomment this section for Zero Boundary Conditions
  114 : fespace Vh(Th, P1);
  115 : Vh uh, vh, hx, hy, F; // Functions living in Vh
  116 : varf aa(uh,vh)= int2d(Th)( dx(uh)*dx(vh) +dy(uh)*dy(vh) ) 
  117 :                 +on(901,902,903,904, uh=0);
  118 : 
  119 : // add one int1d for each particle in the array
  120 : varf ff(unused, vh)= -int1d(Th,0)( (mx(0)*N.x +my(0)*N.y)*vh )
  121 :                      //-int1d(Th,1)( (mx(1)*N.x +my(1)*N.y)*vh )
  122 :                       ;
  123 : 
  124 : // Initiating magnetization. We also use this cicle to 
  125 : // compute the volume of the particles and the total volume
  126 : V(0)= int2d(Thaux0)(1.0);
  127 : Tvolume = 0.0;
  128 : 
  129 : for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  130 :     randinit( seed*clock() );
  131 :     theta= randreal2()*45.0*pi/180.0;
  132 :     mx(i)= cos(theta);
  133 :     my(i)= sin(theta);
  134 :     Tvolume= Tvolume +V(i);
  135 : }
  136 : cout << "M_initial=" << "	 mx=" << mx(0) << "	 my=" << my(0) << "	 m^2=" <<mx(0)^2 + my(0)^2 << endl;
  137 : 
  138 : hi= initialfield;
  139 : hf= finalfield;
  140 : dh = (hf-hi)/npoints;
  141 : while (hi<hf){
  142 :     h= [0.0,hi];
  143 :     flag=0;
  144 :     st=0.5;
  145 :     it=0;
  146 :     cout << "Getting the magnetization for h=" << hi << endl;
  147 :     while (flag==0){
  148 :         s1=0;
  149 :         s2=0;
  150 :         mxpast = mx;
  151 :         mypast = my;
  152 :         // Solving the weak form
  153 :         A = aa(Vh,Vh);
  154 :         F[] = ff(0,Vh);
  155 :         uh[] = A^-1*F[];
  156 :         hx = dx(uh);
  157 :         hy = dy(uh);
  158 :         // Computing energy for actual state
  159 :         E0= 0.5*int2d(Th)( hx*hx +hy*hy ); // Magnetostatic energy term
  160 :         for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  161 :         E0= E0 -V(i)*( mx(i)*h[0] +my(i)*h[1] ); // Zeeman energy term
  162 :         }
  163 :         // Computing the Gradient with respect m of each particle
  164 :         for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  165 :             Gradmx(i)= -int1d(Th,i)( uh*N.x ) -V(i)*h[0];
  166 :             Gradmy(i)= -int1d(Th,i)( uh*N.y ) -V(i)*h[1];
  167 :             gnorm= sqrt(Gradmx(i)^2.0 +Gradmy(i)^2.0);
  168 :             dirx= Gradmx(i)/gnorm;
  169 :             diry= Gradmy(i)/gnorm;
  170 :             // Moving the magnetization to the posterior state
  171 :             mx(i)= mx(i) -st*dirx +beta*randreal1();
  172 :             my(i)= my(i) -st*diry +beta*randreal1();
  173 :             mnorm= sqrt( mx(i)^2.0 +my(i)^2.0 );
  174 :             mx(i)= mx(i)/mnorm;
  175 :             my(i)= my(i)/mnorm;
  176 :         }
  177 :         //cout << "M_h"<< hi << "=" << mx(0) << "__" << my(0) <<"__" <<mx(0)^2 + my(0)^2 << endl;
  178 :         // Solving the weak form for the posterior state
  179 :         A= aa(Vh,Vh);
  180 :         F[]= ff(0,Vh);
  181 :         uh[]= A^-1*F[];
  182 :         hx= dx(uh); hy= dy(uh);
  183 :         // Computing energy for the posterior state
  184 :         E1= 0.5*int2d(Th)( hx*hx +hy*hy );
  185 :         for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  186 :         E1= E1 -V(i)*( mx(i)*h[0] +my(i)*h[1] );
  187 :         }
  188 :         dE= E0 -E1;
  189 :         if (E0 -E1 > 0){
  190 :             //cout << hi << "  OK  " << E0 << "\t" << E1 << "\t" <<
  191 :             //    mx(0) << "\t" << my(0) <<  endl;
  192 :             s1=1.0;
  193 :         }
  194 :         else{
  195 :             //cout << hi << "  Error  " << E0 << "\t" << E1 << "\t" <<
  196 :             //    mx(0) << "\t" << my(0) <<  endl;
  197 :             st= 0.5*st;
  198 :             mx= mxpast;
  199 :             my= mypast;
  200 :         }
  201 :         if (abs(dE) < 1e-8){
  202 :             s1=1.0;
  203 :         }
  204 :         if (abs(dE) < t){
  205 :             s2= 1.0;   
  206 :         }
  207 :         //cout << hi << "\t" << s1 << "\t" << dE << "\t" << s2 << endl;
  208 :         cout << "h=" <<hi << "	 E0=" << E0 << endl;
  209 :         if (s1*s2 >= 1){
  210 :             flag=1;
  211 :         }  
  212 :     }
  213 :     plot(uh ,value=1, wait=0, fill=1);
  214 :     mtotx=0.0;
  215 :     mtoty=0.0;
  216 :     for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  217 :         mtotx= mtotx +mx(i)*V(i)/Tvolume;
  218 :         mtoty= mtoty +my(i)*V(i)/Tvolume;
  219 :     }
  220 :     Ea= 0.5*int2d(Th)( hx*hx +hy*hy );
  221 :     for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  222 :     Ea= Ea -V(i)*( mx(i)*h[0] +my(i)*h[1] );
  223 :     }
  224 :     cout << "Energy minimum found for h=" << hi << endl;
  225 :     cout << "M=(" << mtotx << "," << mtoty << ")" << endl;
  226 :     cout << "E=" << Ea << endl;
  227 :     outfile << (h(0)) +"	"+ (h(1)) +"	"+ mtotx +"	"+ mtoty << endl;
  228 :     efile << Ea +"	" +mx(0) +"	" +my(0) << endl;
  229 :     it= it+1;
  230 :     hi = hi +dh;
  231 : }
  232 : 
  233 : //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  234 : // DOWNWARD CYCLE
  235 : //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  236 : 
  237 : hi= finalfield;
  238 : hf= initialfield;
  239 : dh= (hf-hi)/npoints;
  240 : //while (hi>hf){

  272 :             my(i)= my(i) -st*diry +beta*randreal1();

-- FreeFem++ v4.15 (Wed Dec 11 16:48:56 CET 2024 - git v4.15-7-gb1e524c8c)
   file : StonerW.edp
 Load: lg_fem lg_mesh lg_mesh3 eigenvalue 
    1 : real a0;
    2 : ifstream entrada("input_a0.txt");
    3 : entrada >> a0;
    4 : 
    5 : real phi = pi/2.0 - a0; // mant√©n esto si phi depende de a0
    6 : 
    7 : verbosity = 1;
    8 : real cpu = clock();
    9 : int seed = 123456789;
   10 : //randinit(100*clock());
   11 : 
   12 : /**
   13 : Variable Definitions
   14 : */
   15 : 
   16 : int npart = 1; //Number of particles
   17 : real boxwd = 20.0; // width of the cell containing the system
   18 : real boxht = 20.0; // height of the cell containing the system
   19 : real xradius = 1.0; // horizontal axis of the particles
   20 : real yradius = 2.0; // vertical axis of the particles
   21 : real xshift = 0.0; // horizontal shift from the center of the cell
   22 : real yshift = 0.0; // vertical shift form the center of the cell
   23 : //real a0 = 89.9*pi/180.0; // Tilt angle measured from +x axis. 
   24 : //real phi = pi/2.0 -a0; // angle between easy axis and external app field
   25 : real npoints = 57.0; //points in half the hysteresis curve
   26 : int mp = 50; // number of points in the mesh "meshpoints"
   27 : real beta = 3e-6; // constant to enter random variations
   28 : real t=1e-3; // tolerance for the code 
   29 : real initialfield = -5.0; // initial field
   30 : real finalfield = 5.0; // final (end) field
   31 : 
   32 : 
   33 : // real[int] is a vector of "int" elements. Each element is a real
   34 : real[int] mx(npart); //mx is vector storing horizontal magnetization
   35 : real[int] mxpast(npart); // mx in a past state for comparison
   36 : real[int] my(npart); //my is a vector storing vertical magnetization
   37 : real[int] mypast(npart); // my in a past state for comparison
   38 : real[int] V(npart); //V is a vector storing the volume of each particle
   39 : real[int] h(2); // vector storing the external magnetic field
   40 : real[int] Gradmx(2); // horizontal component of the Grad
   41 : real[int] Gradmy(2); // vertical component of the Grad 
   42 : real Tvolume; // Total volume 
   43 : real theta;
   44 : real hi; // auxiliar variable for external field
   45 : real hf; // auxiliar variable for external field
   46 : real dh; // Step to change the external field
   47 : real E0; // Energy in the actual system
   48 : real E1; // Energy in the state with proposed magnetization
   49 : real Ea; // Energy in the state with optimal magnetization for monitoring the energy
   50 : real gnorm; // Norm of the gradient
   51 : real mnorm; // Norm of the magnetization
   52 : real dirx; // Horizontal component of the normalized gradient
   53 : real diry; // Vertical component of the normalized gradient
   54 : real st; // step
   55 : real dE; // Energy difference
   56 : real mtotx; // total horizontal magnetization 
   57 : real mtoty; // total vertical magnetization
   58 : real it; // iteration counter
   59 : real flag; // Auxiliar variable that acts as a flag 
   60 : matrix A; // Matrix for the variational formulation
   61 : real s1; // Switch for conditionals
   62 : real s2; // Switch for conditionals
   63 : 
   64 : 
   65 : /**
   66 : Variables computed on the above
   67 : */
   68 : real xcenter= boxwd/2.0;
   69 : real ycenter= boxht/2.0;
   70 : 
   71 : /**
   72 : Filename generator
   73 : */
   74 : 
   75 : string name = "SW"+"X"+string(xradius)+"Y"+string(yradius)+"A"+string(phi*180.0/pi);
   76 : ofstream outfile(name+".txt");
   77 : //ofstream outfile("tester"+string(phi*180.0/pi)+".txt");
   78 : //ofstream outfile("tester.txt");
   79 : ofstream efile("Efile.txt");
   80 : 
   81 : /**
   82 : Space under construction
   83 : */
   84 : border b1(t=0.0,boxwd){x=t; y=0.0; label=901;};
   85 : border b2(t=0.0,boxht){x=boxwd; y=t; label=902;};
   86 : border b3(t=0.0,boxwd){x=boxwd-t; y=boxht; label=903;};
   87 : border b4(t=0.0,boxht){x=0.0; y=boxht-t; label=904;};
   88 : 
   89 : border B0(t=0, 2.0*pi){
   90 :   x= xcenter +xradius*cos(t)*cos(a0) -yradius*sin(t)*sin(a0) +xshift;
   91 :   y= ycenter +xradius*cos(t)*sin(a0) +yradius*sin(t)*cos(a0) +yshift;
   92 :   label=0;
   93 : };
   94 : 
   95 : mesh Th = buildmesh(b1(mp)+ b2(mp)+ b3(mp)+ b4(mp)+ B0(-mp) );
   96 : //plot(Th, wait=1);
   97 : 
   98 : // Auxiliar mesh to calculate the volume of each partile
   99 : // Make one for every particle in the volume count
  100 : mesh Thaux0 = buildmesh(B0(mp));
  101 : 
  102 : /**
  103 : Constructing the variational formulation and space functions
  104 : */
  105 : 
  106 : // Uncomment this section for periodic boundary conditions
  107 : /**
  108 : fespace Vh(Th, P1, periodic=[[901,x],[903,x],[902,y],[904,y]]);
  109 : Vh uh, vh, hx, hy, F;
  110 : varf aa(uh,vh)= int2d(Th)( dx(uh)*dx(vh) +dy(uh)*dy(vh) );
  111 : */
  112 : 
  113 : // Uncomment this section for Zero Boundary Conditions
  114 : fespace Vh(Th, P1);
  115 : Vh uh, vh, hx, hy, F; // Functions living in Vh
  116 : varf aa(uh,vh)= int2d(Th)( dx(uh)*dx(vh) +dy(uh)*dy(vh) ) 
  117 :                 +on(901,902,903,904, uh=0);
  118 : 
  119 : // add one int1d for each particle in the array
  120 : varf ff(unused, vh)= -int1d(Th,0)( (mx(0)*N.x +my(0)*N.y)*vh )
  121 :                      //-int1d(Th,1)( (mx(1)*N.x +my(1)*N.y)*vh )
  122 :                       ;
  123 : 
  124 : // Initiating magnetization. We also use this cicle to 
  125 : // compute the volume of the particles and the total volume
  126 : V(0)= int2d(Thaux0)(1.0);
  127 : Tvolume = 0.0;
  128 : 
  129 : for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  130 :     randinit( seed*clock() );
  131 :     theta= randreal2()*45.0*pi/180.0;
  132 :     mx(i)= cos(theta);
  133 :     my(i)= sin(theta);
  134 :     Tvolume= Tvolume +V(i);
  135 : }
  136 : cout << "M_initial=" << "	 mx=" << mx(0) << "	 my=" << my(0) << "	 m^2=" <<mx(0)^2 + my(0)^2 << endl;
  137 : 
  138 : hi= initialfield;
  139 : hf= finalfield;
  140 : dh = (hf-hi)/npoints;
  141 : while (hi<hf){
  142 :     h= [0.0,hi];
  143 :     flag=0;
  144 :     st=0.5;
  145 :     it=0;
  146 :     cout << "Getting the magnetization for h=" << hi << endl;
  147 :     while (flag==0){
  148 :         s1=0;
  149 :         s2=0;
  150 :         mxpast = mx;
  151 :         mypast = my;
  152 :         // Solving the weak form
  153 :         A = aa(Vh,Vh);
  154 :         F[] = ff(0,Vh);
  155 :         uh[] = A^-1*F[];
  156 :         hx = dx(uh);
  157 :         hy = dy(uh);
  158 :         // Computing energy for actual state
  159 :         E0= 0.5*int2d(Th)( hx*hx +hy*hy ); // Magnetostatic energy term
  160 :         for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  161 :         E0= E0 -V(i)*( mx(i)*h[0] +my(i)*h[1] ); // Zeeman energy term
  162 :         }
  163 :         // Computing the Gradient with respect m of each particle
  164 :         for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  165 :             Gradmx(i)= -int1d(Th,i)( uh*N.x ) -V(i)*h[0];
  166 :             Gradmy(i)= -int1d(Th,i)( uh*N.y ) -V(i)*h[1];
  167 :             gnorm= sqrt(Gradmx(i)^2.0 +Gradmy(i)^2.0);
  168 :             dirx= Gradmx(i)/gnorm;
  169 :             diry= Gradmy(i)/gnorm;
  170 :             // Moving the magnetization to the posterior state
  171 :             mx(i)= mx(i) -st*dirx +beta*randreal1();
  172 :             my(i)= my(i) -st*diry +beta*randreal1();
  173 :             mnorm= sqrt( mx(i)^2.0 +my(i)^2.0 );
  174 :             mx(i)= mx(i)/mnorm;
  175 :             my(i)= my(i)/mnorm;
  176 :         }
  177 :         //cout << "M_h"<< hi << "=" << mx(0) << "__" << my(0) <<"__" <<mx(0)^2 + my(0)^2 << endl;
  178 :         // Solving the weak form for the posterior state
  179 :         A= aa(Vh,Vh);
  180 :         F[]= ff(0,Vh);
  181 :         uh[]= A^-1*F[];
  182 :         hx= dx(uh); hy= dy(uh);
  183 :         // Computing energy for the posterior state
  184 :         E1= 0.5*int2d(Th)( hx*hx +hy*hy );
  185 :         for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  186 :         E1= E1 -V(i)*( mx(i)*h[0] +my(i)*h[1] );
  187 :         }
  188 :         dE= E0 -E1;
  189 :         if (E0 -E1 > 0){
  190 :             //cout << hi << "  OK  " << E0 << "\t" << E1 << "\t" <<
  191 :             //    mx(0) << "\t" << my(0) <<  endl;
  192 :             s1=1.0;
  193 :         }
  194 :         else{
  195 :             //cout << hi << "  Error  " << E0 << "\t" << E1 << "\t" <<
  196 :             //    mx(0) << "\t" << my(0) <<  endl;
  197 :             st= 0.5*st;
  198 :             mx= mxpast;
  199 :             my= mypast;
  200 :         }
  201 :         if (abs(dE) < 1e-8){
  202 :             s1=1.0;
  203 :         }
  204 :         if (abs(dE) < t){
  205 :             s2= 1.0;   
  206 :         }
  207 :         //cout << hi << "\t" << s1 << "\t" << dE << "\t" << s2 << endl;
  208 :         cout << "h=" <<hi << "	 E0=" << E0 << endl;
  209 :         if (s1*s2 >= 1){
  210 :             flag=1;
  211 :         }  
  212 :     }
  213 :     plot(uh ,value=1, wait=0, fill=1);
  214 :     mtotx=0.0;
  215 :     mtoty=0.0;
  216 :     for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  217 :         mtotx= mtotx +mx(i)*V(i)/Tvolume;
  218 :         mtoty= mtoty +my(i)*V(i)/Tvolume;
  219 :     }
  220 :     Ea= 0.5*int2d(Th)( hx*hx +hy*hy );
  221 :     for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  222 :     Ea= Ea -V(i)*( mx(i)*h[0] +my(i)*h[1] );
  223 :     }
  224 :     cout << "Energy minimum found for h=" << hi << endl;
  225 :     cout << "M=(" << mtotx << "," << mtoty << ")" << endl;
  226 :     cout << "E=" << Ea << endl;
  227 :     outfile << (h(0)) +"	"+ (h(1)) +"	"+ mtotx +"	"+ mtoty << endl;
  228 :     efile << Ea +"	" +mx(0) +"	" +my(0) << endl;
  229 :     it= it+1;
  230 :     hi = hi +dh;
  231 : }
  232 : 
  233 : //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  234 : // DOWNWARD CYCLE
  235 : //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  236 : 
  237 : hi= finalfield;
  238 : hf= initialfield;
  239 : dh= (hf-hi)/npoints;
  240 : //while (hi>hf){
  241 : while (hi>hf){
  242 :     h= [0.0,hi];
  243 :     flag=0;
  244 :     st=0.5;
  245 :     it=0;
  246 :     cout << "Getting the magnetization for h=" << hi << endl;
  247 :     while (flag==0){
  248 :         s1=0;
  249 :         s2=0;
  250 :         mxpast = mx;
  251 :         mypast = my;
  252 :         // Solving the weak form
  253 :         A = aa(Vh,Vh);
  254 :         F[] = ff(0,Vh);
  255 :         uh[] = A^-1*F[];
  256 :         hx = dx(uh);
  257 :         hy = dy(uh);
  258 :         // Computing energy for actual state
  259 :         E0= 0.5*int2d(Th)( hx*hx +hy*hy ); // Magnetostatic energy term
  260 :         for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  261 :         E0= E0 -V(i)*( mx(i)*h[0] +my(i)*h[1] ); // Zeeman energy term
  262 :         }
  263 :         // Computing the Gradient with respect m of each particle
  264 :         for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  265 :             Gradmx(i)= -int1d(Th,i)( uh*N.x ) -V(i)*h[0];
  266 :             Gradmy(i)= -int1d(Th,i)( uh*N.y ) -V(i)*h[1];
  267 :             gnorm= sqrt(Gradmx(i)^2.0 +Gradmy(i)^2.0);
  268 :             dirx= Gradmx(i)/gnorm;
  269 :             diry= Gradmy(i)/gnorm;
  270 :             // Moving the magnetization to the posterior state
  271 :             mx(i)= mx(i) -st*dirx +beta*randreal1();
  272 :             my(i)= my(i) -st*diry +beta*randreal1();
  273 :             mnorm= sqrt( mx(i)^2.0 +my(i)^2.0 );
  274 :             mx(i)= mx(i)/mnorm;
  275 :             my(i)= my(i)/mnorm;
  276 :         }
  277 :         //cout << "M_h"<< hi << "=" << mx(0) << "__" << my(0) <<"__" <<mx(0)^2 + my(0)^2 << endl;
  278 :         // Solving the weak form for the posterior state
  279 :         A= aa(Vh,Vh);
  280 :         F[]= ff(0,Vh);
  281 :         uh[]= A^-1*F[];
  282 :         hx= dx(uh); hy= dy(uh);
  283 :         // Computing energy for the posterior state
  284 :         E1= 0.5*int2d(Th)( hx*hx +hy*hy );
  285 :         for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){
  286 :         E1= E1 -V(i)*( mx(i)*h[0] +my(i)*h[1] );
  287 :         }
  288 :         dE= E0 -E1;
  289 :         if (E0 -E1 > 0){
  290 :             //cout << hi << "  OK  " << E0 << "\t" << E1 << "\t" <<
  291 :             //    mx(0) << "\t" << my(0) <<  endl;
  292 :             s1=1.0;
  293 :         }
  294 :         else{
  295 :             //cout << hi << "  Error  " << E0 << "\t" << E1 << "\t" <<
  296 :             //    mx(0) << "\t" << my(0) <<  endl;
  297 :             st= 0.5*st;
  298 :             mx= mxpast;
  299 :             my= mypast;
  300 :         }
  301 :         if (abs(dE) < 1e-8){
  302 :             s1=1.0;
  303 :         }
  304 :         if (abs(dE) < t){
  305 :             s2= 1.0;   
  306 :         }
  307 :         //cout << hi << "\t" << s1 << "\t" << dE << "\t" << s2 << endl;
  308 :         cout << "h=" <<hi << "	 E0=" << E0 << endl;
  309 :         if (s1*s2 >= 1){
  310 :             flag=1;
  311 :         }  
  312 :     }
  313 :     plot(uh ,value=1, wait=0, fill=1);
  314 :     mtotx=0.0;
  315 :     mtoty=0.0;
  316 :     for (int i=0; i<npart; i++){

  318 :         mtoty= mtoty +my(i)*V(i)/Tvolume;
